definitions.definition: an amount of money, space, etc. that is given to somebody for a particular purpose

examples.text: We have spent our entire allocation for the year.
The allocation must be made according to a strict set of criteria.
The charity is trying to get its allocation increased for next year.
The school gave them a generous allocation of money with which to purchase books.
The project was financed by an allocation of funds from the National Lottery.

definitions.definition: the act of giving something to somebody for a particular purpose

examples.text: the allocation of food to those who need it most

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from medieval Latin allocatio(n-), from the verb allocare, from ad- ‘to’ + locare, from locus ‘place’.
